item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll’s dedicated Help repository.

item.title: Best New Apps: Workflow
item.description:
Released late last year, I ended up downloading Workflow this week. It’s mindblowing. Long story short, it allows you to make custom apps straight from your iPhone. If you were looking to have some (nerdy) fun with your iOS device, this is it.

Make a run for the AppStore while it’s 60% off.

item.title: Fuck You, Pay Me
item.description: This video goes way back to 2011, and I couldn’t care less. If you have already watched this legendary talk from Mike Monteiro, watch it again. Then read the follow-up book by the old man, Design is a Job.

item.title: I was forced into a long distance relationship and it was terrible so I made an app to make it less terrible.
item.description: So, cute problem-solving is a thing now?

item.title: Designers Who Code
item.description: This is pretty much the nail in the coffin of the “Should designers code?” discussion. Designers who don’t code shouldn’t be dead worried, but seriously, read it.

item.title: Favicons, Touch Icons, Tile Icons, etc. What All Do You Need?
item.description: A handy primer to favicons and their kin.

item.title: Welcome to Business Town
item.description: Weirdly amusing comics about our “highly intangible, deeply disruptive, data-driven, venture-backed, gluten-free economic meritocracy.”

item.title: Positioning in Web Design
item.description: An animated guide to positioning. Pretty handy!

item.title: Fear of Writing
item.description: For someone who constantly flakes out when trying to write, this really hits home.

item.title: How to Give Feedback that Doesn’t Suck
item.description: I’ve seen design feedback sessions go both uphill and crashing terribly downhill. With that, here are my 6 guidelines of how to give feedback that doesn’t suck.
